label: 413. Madame Baptiste to Bp Patrick Lynch -- May 20, 1866
description: Short letter from Madame Baptiste to Bishop Patrick Lynch about the ongoing effort to solicit funds for a new convent including writing a letter to General Sherman to "recommend our cause at Washington." May 20, 1866. 2p.

metadata.label: Description
metadata.value: Short letter from Madame Baptiste to Bishop Patrick Lynch about the ongoing effort to solicit funds for a new convent including writing a letter to General Sherman to "recommend our cause at Washington." May 20, 1866. 2p.

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: A.M.D.G Ursuline Convent & Academy Valle Crucis--near Columbia, S.C. May 20th 1866 My Dearest Brother, I have just received a letter from Mr. L. Jones (with $200, enclosed) in which he says you left for New York in "comparative health"--What does he mean by comparative health? Have you been indisposed? I'm afraid you are over-extending yourself. You forget that "Rome was not built in a day." Do you see what a pretty sheet of papers & [illegible] I send you in compliment to your Sisters at the convent, the report of which does credit to the Reporters as well as the [illegible]. Well my dearest Brother I have written you so often[End Page 1] lately that I have no new intelligence to give from [?] any quarters. We are feeling the heat very sensibly now. I am in correspondence with Sister deChantal Cummings & she through Miss Meade is trying to aid us. Miss M. wrote to both Genl Sickles about the rations, & to Genl Sherman to get him to recommend our care at Washington & they have sent me the reply of each, which I [illegible]. All is pleasant with Genl Sickles as you Know & with Genl S--who again denies [?] his acts. I will try & be prudent--of course I write only to Sr DeChantal. I also recd today a letter from the secretary of Chief Justice Chase, who altho' he can give me no advice thinks one petition would receive a Kind & careful consideration--! I am [illegible] surprised. All send ever so many Kind messages with much love from your own Sister Ellen. Sr Baptista[End Page 2]
